org.apache.juneau.rest.client.remote

Class RemoteMethodMeta

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.rest.client.remote.RemoteMethodMeta

  • public class RemoteMethodMeta
extends Object
    Contains the meta-data about a Java method on a REST proxy class.

    Captures the information in @RemoteMethod annotations for caching and reuse.

    See Also:
    • Overview > juneau-rest-client > REST Proxies

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteMethodMeta(String parentPath, Method m, boolean useMethodSignatures, String defaultMethod)
      Constructor.

      Returns the exceptions thrown by this method.

      Returns the @FormData annotated arguments on this Java method.
      String getFullPath()
      Returns the absolute URL of the REST interface invoked by this Java method.

      Returns the @Header annotated arguments on this Java method.

      Returns the value of the @RemoteMethod(httpMethod) annotation on this Java method.

      Returns the underlying Java method that this metadata is about.

      Returns the @Query annotated arguments on this Java method.

      Returns the @Request annotated arguments on this Java method.
      RemoteMethodReturn getReturns()
      Returns whether the method returns the HTTP response body or status code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteMethodMeta

        public RemoteMethodMeta(String parentPath,
                        Method m,
                        boolean useMethodSignatures,
                        String defaultMethod)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        parentPath - The absolute URL of the REST interface backing the interface proxy.
        m - The Java method.
        useMethodSignatures - If true then the default path for the method should be the full method signature.
        defaultMethod - The default HTTP method if not specified through annotation.

    • Method Detail

      • getHttpMethod

        public String getHttpMethod()
        Returns the value of the @RemoteMethod(httpMethod) annotation on this Java method.
        Returns:
        The value of the annotation, never null.

      • getFullPath

        public String getFullPath()
        Returns the absolute URL of the REST interface invoked by this Java method.
        Returns:
        The absolute URL of the REST interface, never null.

      • getPathArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getPathArgs()
        Returns the @Path annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @Path(value) names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getQueryArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getQueryArgs()
        Returns the @Query annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @Query(value) names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getFormDataArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getFormDataArgs()
        Returns the @FormData annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @FormData(value) names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getHeaderArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getHeaderArgs()
        Returns the @Header annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A map of @Header(value) names to zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getRequestArgs

        public RemoteMethodBeanArg[] getRequestArgs()
        Returns the @Request annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A list of zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getOtherArgs

        public RemoteMethodArg[] getOtherArgs()
        Returns the remaining non-annotated arguments on this Java method.
        Returns:
        A list of zero-indexed argument indices.

      • getBodyArg

        public RemoteMethodArg getBodyArg()
        Returns the argument annotated with @Body.
        Returns:
        A index of the argument with the @Body annotation, or null if no argument exists.

      • getReturns

        public RemoteMethodReturn getReturns()
        Returns whether the method returns the HTTP response body or status code.
        Returns:
        Whether the method returns the HTTP response body or status code.

      • getPath

        public String getPath()
        Returns the HTTP path of this method.
        Returns:
        The HTTP path of this method relative to the parent interface.
        Never null.
        Never has leading or trailing slashes.

      • getJavaMethod

        public Method getJavaMethod()
        Returns the underlying Java method that this metadata is about.
        Returns:
        The underlying Java method that this metadata is about.
        Never null.

      • getExceptions

        public Class<?>[] getExceptions()
        Returns the exceptions thrown by this method.
        Returns:
        The exceptions thrown by this method. Never null.
